dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 7900 IH: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Smith of Washington (by request) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2023 for military activities of the Department of Defense and for military construction, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023.
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 103. Air Force and Space Force.
Title II—Research, Development, Test, and Evaluation
Sec. 401. End strengths for active forces.
Sec. 413. End strengths for military technicians (dual status).
Sec. 414. Maximum number of reserve personnel authorized to be on active duty for operational support.
Sec. 1402. Chemical agents and munitions destruction, defense.
Sec. 1403. Drug interdiction and counter-drug activities, defense.

section.text: Funds are hereby authorized to be appropriated for fiscal year 2023 for procurement for the Army as follows:

paragraph.text: For weapons and tracked combat vehicles, $3,576,030,000.

section.text: Funds are hereby authorized to be appropriated for fiscal year 2023 for procurement for the Navy and Marine Corps as follows:

paragraph.text: For ammunition procurement, Navy and Marine Corps, $1,052,292,000.

section.text: Funds are hereby authorized to be appropriated for fiscal year 2023 for procurement for the Air Force and Space Force as follows:
Funds are hereby authorized to be appropriated for fiscal year 2023 for the use of the Department of Defense for research, development, test, and evaluation as follows:

paragraph.text: For the Director of Operational Test and Evaluation, $277,194,000.

section.text: The Armed Forces are authorized strengths for active duty personnel as of September 30, 2023, as follows:

section.header: End strengths for military technicians (dual status)
section.text: The minimum number of military technicians (dual status) as of the last day of fiscal year 2023 for the reserve components of the Army and the Air Force (notwithstanding section 129 of title 10, United States Code) shall be the following:

paragraph.text: For the Army National Guard of the United States, 22,294.
For the Air National Guard of the United States, 9,892.

section.header: Maximum number of reserve personnel authorized to be on active duty for operational support
section.text: During fiscal year 2023, the maximum number of members of the reserve components of the Armed Forces who may be serving at any time on full-time operational support duty under section 115(b) of title 10, United States Code, is the following:

paragraph.text: The Army National Guard of the United States, 17,000.
The Air National Guard of the United States, 16,000.

section.text: There is hereby authorized to be appropriated for military personnel for fiscal year 2023 a total of $164,139,628,000.

Funds are hereby authorized to be appropriated for fiscal year 2023 for the use of the Armed Forces and other activities and agencies of the Department of Defense for providing capital for working capital and revolving funds in the amount of $1,583,395,000.

section.header: Chemical agents and munitions destruction, defense

subsection.text: Funds are hereby authorized to be appropriated for the Department of Defense for fiscal year 2023 for expenses, not otherwise provided for, for Chemical Agents and Munitions Destruction, Defense, in the amount of $1,059,818,000 of which—

paragraph.text: $84,612,000 is for Operation and Maintenance; and
$975,206,000 is for Research, Development, Test, and Evaluation.

subsection.text: Amounts authorized to be appropriated under subsection (a) are authorized for—

paragraph.text: the destruction of lethal chemical agents and munitions in accordance with section 1412 of the Department of Defense Authorization Act, 1986 (50 U.S.C. 1521); and
the destruction of chemical warfare materiel of the United States that is not covered by section 1412 of such Act.

section.header: Drug interdiction and counter-drug activities, defense
section.text: Funds are hereby authorized to be appropriated for the Department of Defense for fiscal year 2023 for expenses, not otherwise provided for, for Drug Interdiction and Counter-Drug Activities, Defense, in the amount of $855,728,000.

Funds are hereby authorized to be appropriated for the Department of Defense for fiscal year 2023 for expenses, not otherwise provided for, for the Office of the Inspector General of the Department of Defense, in the amount of $479,359,000 of which—

paragraph.text: $1,864,000 is for Research, Development, Test and Evaluation; and

section.text: Funds are hereby authorized to be appropriated for the Department of Defense for fiscal year 2023 for expenses, not otherwise provided for, for the Defense Health Program, in the amount of $36,932,174,000 of which—

paragraph.text: $909,994,000 is for Research, Development, Test, and Evaluation;
$137,356,000 is for Software and Digital Technology Pilot Programs.
